contract.companyDescription: Retail and consumer merchandise - "With over 600 brands and free delivery options we've got you covered on the beach, mountain and the street."
overview: Recruited to assist in the formation and execution of the technical management team's plan to advance the front-end technology behind the Surfdome.com ecommerce website.

Specifically responsible for re-writing the existing code base to a more modular and scalable state with modern libraries and well designed architecture, to improve and supervise existing code standards and workflow practices, and to help the development team to grow on this basis going forward.
responsibilities: Designing and recommending a completely new front-end strategy and code architecture for the given functional and non-functional requirements
Prototyping with modern libraries such as Twitter's Flight.js to create mini-apps replicating legacy site functionality for proof of concept purposes
Introducing new front-end developer workflow and asset management procedures, substituting zero front-end automation and server-side Rails asset pipeline with Node.js and Gulp
Establishing previously absent formal code style guidelines, as well as the practical means to enforce them, and authoring long-term developer team documentation
Assist with the hiring process and co-conduct interviews to objectively identify the suitability or not of a given candidate

contract.companyDescription: Worldwide digital agency. Clients include Nike, Microsoft, Volkswagen, Heineken, Barclays, Barclaycard, Mini, Audi, and many more.
overview: AKQA, one of the world's largest and most successful digital agencies, were set to deliver a new website for one of their UK clients - Barclaycard - to help launch a new consumer product.

Hired as part of a two man development team to build the front-end of the new site, together we worked within a wider team of AKQA creative designers, UX designers, copywriters, QA testers, project manager and a technical delivery manager.

contract.companyDescription: Broadcast media company. "A leading provider of Smart Solutions for Connected Broadcasters and Operators - Backed by Arqiva."
overview: At this highly innovative company - owned by Arqiva, a leading communications infrastructure company - I was drafted in to develop a white-label product for a new multi-channel live TV streaming web application accessible on desktops, tablets, and mobile devices (similar concept to BBC iPlayer).
The end product of this project can be seen on the Portfolio page under the entry entitled "Capablue TV Everywhere".

After the success of this project, I was subsequently asked to build from scratch a completely new version of Capablue's own company website. Working with a freelance Designer, a Junior Developer, QA Testers, Project Manager, and Marketing Manager, I led the development and together we successfully delivered the new website.
The new site can be seen at www.capablue.com and a technical description is available on the Portfolio page.

permanent.companyDescription: Award winning B2B marketing agency. Some of their clients include Cisco, Autodesk, Vodafone, MasterCard, and Sky. Recently merged with OgilvyOne and now known as OgilvyOne dnx.
overview: Working at this multi award winning agency (B2B Agency of the Year 2012 & 2013) - since acquired by Ogilvy & Mather - my job was to collaborate with project teams that consist of account managers, designers, copywriters, and project managers, and build the agreed creative solution within the set time-frame and budget.

This predominantly involved building responsive websites with varying and wide-ranging client-side and server-side requirements, but also although less often, HTML emails, animated banners, and games.
responsibilities: Coding the responsive front-end of new websites with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/JQuery, and the Twitter Bootstrap framework
Coding the back-end of new websites with PHP, MySQL, using the CodeIgniter MVC framework
Ensuring that Git repositories are kept up to date, well documented, and that branches are managed responsibly
Testing new websites to ensure presentation and functional correctness in all browsers and on all devices required

Meeting with account managers and project managers to be briefed on new projects, and liaising with designers and other developers to propose, discuss, and agree on the envisaged end product and its technical makeup
Supporting other developers with technical input and general guidance
Running team meetings once every week, submitting meeting agendas, facilitating discussion and agreement, recording and sharing minutes, pursuing action

permanent.companyDescription: Marketing agency producing mostly company sites for small and medium sized businesses.
overview: My role at this marketing agency primarily was to build new websites based on the visual designs produced by the creative team.

As the leading developer I worked to one extent or another on the majority of all projects collaborating closely with the company directors, web designers, and the project manager from kick-off to completion.
responsibilities: Creating fresh new websites ranging from static brochure sites, to CMS driven sites and more bespoke sites
Providing technical input to support project requirements gathering and internal processes
Liaising with clients in relation to ongoing maintenance for previously developed websites

permanent.companyDescription: A small music school based in Enfield, north London that also has an ecommerce operation selling musical instruments online.
overview: I was responsible for developing, maintaining, and advancing the company's efforts to sell its products on the Internet via its various ecommerce websites. This involved working with a range of technologies such as HTML, CSS, ASP, PHP, MySQL, MS SQL, and WordPress.
responsibilities: Expanding main ecommerce website developing new functionality and implementing change as described by the business manager and company director
Supporting development towards new websites selling the company products

permanent.companyDescription: This ecommerce startup was a very ambitious and rapidly growing online retailer that sold top brand musical instruments such as Yamaha, Casio, and Roland.
overview: Within the IT department of this ecommerce company, my job was to conduct wide-ranging maintenance and testing on the company's ecommerce website.
responsibilities: Implementing front-end additions/amends for the main ecommerce website (HTML, CSS, ASP)
Working through reported issues/errors/bugs with the site - fix, test and confirm as resolved
Routine testing and documenting of discovered issues/errors/bugs
Expanding main ecommerce website developing new functionality and implementing change as described by the business manager and company director
Supporting development towards new websites selling the company products
